channel.title: Jasper | Open Source | Scratch Framework | Built from the ground up
channel.description:
[center][b][size=18pt]Jasper[/size][/b][/center] [b][size=10pt]Welcome to the Jasper project thread, pretty much what this is just a framework i'm doing for fun. I will be using Netty 3.6.6 library because I feel comfortable and it's easy enough to implement. I started this project originally as Trident but i'm just getting around to writing the code now. I will be trying to write code for this everyday and I would love feedback from everyone so I can improve this to the best of my standards.[/size][/b]
[size=10pt][b]Important Links:[/b][/size]
[ul][li][url=https://github.com/jees/jasper]Github[/url][/li][/ul]
[b][size=10pt]The Team:[/size][/b]
[ul][li]Myself[/li] [li]Iz3 Legend (My fanboy)[/li][/ul]
[b][size=10pt]Media:[/size][/b] - None ATM
[b][size=10pt]Credits:[/size][/b]
[ul][li]Iz3 Legend[/li] [li]Atomicint_[/li] [li]Graham[/li] [li]Sean[/li] [li]Juan[/li][/ul]

item.title: Jasper | Open Source | Scratch Framework | Built from the ground up
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

github.com

jees/jasper/blob/master/src/net/rs/comet/Comet.java

package net.rs.comet;

import net.rs.comet.fabric.ConcurrentGameServer;
import net.rs.comet.fabric.ConcurrentGameServerImpl;
import net.rs.comet.fabric.protocol.packet.PacketRegistrey;
import net.rs.comet.model.game.entity.mob.MobSpawnLoader;
import net.rs.comet.model.game.object.GameObjectLoader;
import net.rs.comet.utilities.ApplicationConstants;

public class Comet {
 //TRY THIS
	/**
	 * The current loading stage of the application.
	 */
	private static LoadingStage stage = LoadingStage.LOAD_DATA;

	/**
	 * The possible loading stages of the start-up procedure.
	 */
	private enum LoadingStage {
This file has been truncated. show original

This isn’t done right and is a bit unnecessary.

item.title: Jasper | Open Source | Scratch Framework | Built from the ground up
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Ares_, post:10, topic:529337”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=648092.msg4359246#msg4359246 date=1378354788]

Alright Dylan and I are now working on Jasper together using Comet (going to fix and re-do things I do not like). Anyways the first thing I will be doing is re writing some of the Entity system.

[ul][li]Entity[list]
[li]Actor[list]
[li]Combatable[list]
[li]Player[/li]
[li]Mob[/li]
[/list][/li]
[li]Npc[/li]
[/list][/li]
[li]GroundItem[/li]
[li]Projectiles[/li]
[/list][/li][/ul]

WHY DONT YOU NOOBS EVER USE MY WAY!!!

I have a request. Please, make the design in your next servers something like this:

  • indicates extension/implementation.

Model.java

  • Character.java
    – NPC.java
  • Object.java
  • Item.java

It’s a very nice design I’d like to see in a server.

[/quote]

Because the naming looks bad, it’s hard to follow from what you posted. Also there are two types of ‘mobs’ ones that have combat definitions applied to them and ones that do not have combat definitions sorry.[/quote]
Well, my main focus was on NPC extending Character.

Read full topic

item.title: Jasper | Open Source | Scratch Framework | Built from the ground up
item.dc:creator: @Cyberus Cyberus
item.description:
@Cyberus wrote:

[quote=“Ares_, post:12, topic:529337”][quote author=Mikey Sasse link=topic=648092.msg4359663#msg4359663 date=1378432827]

Alright Dylan and I are now working on Jasper together using Comet (going to fix and re-do things I do not like). Anyways the first thing I will be doing is re writing some of the Entity system.

[ul][li]Entity[list]
[li]Actor[list]
[li]Combatable[list]
[li]Player[/li]
[li]Mob[/li]
[/list][/li]
[li]Npc[/li]
[/list][/li]
[li]GroundItem[/li]
[li]Projectiles[/li]
[/list][/li][/ul]

WHY DONT YOU NOOBS EVER USE MY WAY!!!

I have a request. Please, make the design in your next servers something like this:

  • indicates extension/implementation.

Model.java

  • Character.java
    – NPC.java
  • Object.java
  • Item.java

It’s a very nice design I’d like to see in a server.

It’s annoying to use Character because there’s a class already named that in Java.

Good luck with this.
[/quote]

It’s hard not to use a name that java hasn’t used yet

But thank you mate.[/quote]

not primitive wrappers that are imported by default
